answers.q: ferric ammonium citrate green rock hard, how to reconstitute
answers.a: It cakes but remains highly water‑soluble: break up the mass and dissolve in distilled/deionized water with stirring; gentle warming (up to ~40–50°C) can help, then filter if needed and store airtight with a desiccant to prevent re‑hardening.

answers.q: ferric ammonium citrate rock hard, how to reconstitute
answers.a: Crush to increase surface area and dissolve in deionized water under vigorous stirring; mild heat aids dissolution—avoid boiling—and store the solid or solution tightly sealed to limit moisture cycling and caking.
A synthetic, water‑soluble iron(III) complex of citrate with ammonium (E381), used in foods where permitted mainly as an iron fortificant and acidity regulator.

answers.q: how cells uptake ferric ammonium citrate
answers.a: In cell culture it provides non‑transferrin‑bound Fe3+ that is reduced at the membrane and transported primarily via DMT1 as Fe2+; uptake can vary by cell type and conditions.

It is a very water‑soluble green or brown solid used in foods (E381) where allowed as an iron source and acidity regulator; typical use levels follow good manufacturing practice and applicable regulations.
